sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The school of Venus. VVhen lusty lads and lasses meet, and merrily do play; the pleasures are so strong and sweet, both sexes love obey. Tune of, Hail to the mirtle shade.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for Josiah Blare, at the Looking-Glass on London-Bridge., [London] : [between 1684-1700]
Verse: "How long shall I sigh and mourn ..." Date and place of publication from Wing. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
=======
